message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CY

This paper deals with the analysis of texts using complex network theory, which is a common approach in computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also uses machine learning techniques to classify texts as either fiction or non-fiction, which falls under the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG). The use of semantic networks and measures such as clustering coefficient and degree distribution also suggests a possible fit with the sub-category of information retrieval (cs.IR). Additionally, the paper deals with the optimization of parameters such as word distance and text length, which could be relevant to the sub-category of cybernetics (cs.CY). Finally, the paper uses statistical analysis to compare different types of texts, which could also fit under the sub-category of social and information networks (cs.SI).
